message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65: Can you remove the Previous version link to css3-border? It's a little misleading since that was merged into the draft a long time ago and the border definitions immediately previous aren't there

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: removed it for the editor's draft, but doesnt' have write access to w3.org

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Fantasai, I checked with the webmaster and corrected it.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: Thanks!

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65: I'm writing up a blog post for the css3-background publication

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: It's against policy to change a published TR, but it was less than 24 hours...

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Good! (re: blog post)

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I wanted to announce the draft, but also point out some of the issues we want feedback on

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I'll be cross-posting between our blog and css3.info

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: My draft is here http://www.css3.info/?p=709 if you want to take a look :)

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: likes drafting in WordPress better

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Shall I wait with announcing it on www-style so that I can point to the blog?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: yeah, sure!

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I'm almost done :)

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: is just doing some editing to fix grammar errors and the like ;)

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: Why can't I link to external sites on the CSSWG blog?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: can't post this

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: needs to link to Brad's examples page, and to css3.info

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Can't link? That's strange. There are other articles with links.

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: Can you just put plain-text links? It's crappy, but shrug.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: That's what I'm doing

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: slowly

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: it's complaining about something else

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: but it never gives line numbers

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I HATE our blogging system

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: What's the engine?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: b2evo

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: (Won't be able to help, just curious.)

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: B.t.w., your URL gives me a page with just navigation links, no content.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: http://www.css3.info/css3-backgrounds-last-call/

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: That works, but it looks weird in lynx.

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: looks at the mark-up...

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: it's not my fault

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I write good markup!

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: promises the <p> tags are all there

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: Oh, and it also won't let me use fragment identifiers in links to W3C specs

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: just removes those links

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: wtf is up with your blogging engine?

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: That's crazy.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: http://www.w3.org/blog/CSS/2009/10/16/css3_background_lc

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65, if you can fix that...

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I give up

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I hate W3C IT

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: which isn't fair

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: because they're shortstaffed

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: so they can't fix everything

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: but

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: really?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: banning fragment identifiers and external links?

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: I just made a test and fragments work fine.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: why doesn't it work for me?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: maybe you have magic priviledges

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: in that case you can fix the post!

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: Banning fragments doesn't even *start* to make sense.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: I had links to the relevant sections for the various properties mentioned in the post

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I don't think it was intentional.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I think they wanted to ban external links, and their regex forgot to allow fragments

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: or something

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: but it looks like bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 might be able to fix this

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: Still weird. Whatever.

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: is looking at the post

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: It doesn't have a title.

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: What should it be called?

message.author: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
message.text: doesn't understand why any link policy whatsoever is required on a w3c blog.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: "CSS3 Backgrounds and Borders Last Call for Comments"

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: should suffice I think

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: doesn't understand either

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65, I'm still not seeing the title.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: Thanks for fixing the post, though

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: is not going to touch it anymore, in case it breaks again

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Still not getting all the URLs. Which one is it complaining about...?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: bradclicks.com

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: "Rounding Extremes" should be linked to the url after it

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: border-break and background-break should be linked to

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-css3-background-20080910/#the-border-break and http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-css3-background-20080910/#the-background-break

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: respectively

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Yeah, it doesn't want to link to bradclicks.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: hm, maybe it was ok with css3.info then

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: and just didn't want to link to bradclicks or #the-border-break etc.

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: just stripped out all the external URLs because she's run into similar problems before

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: It can't handle fragment IDs with dashes!?

message.author: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65
message.text: Worse: it accepts no dashes anywhere in a URL. :-(

message.author: b844a0a98f81c321afe1d38ae37f3c28
message.text: channel #css

message.author: 25812bf456959aa5f28dc570f341a3ba
message.text: is 'CSS Working Group discussion'

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: oh, so /that's/ the problem

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65, can we import our blog into some other system?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: Doesn't QA run MT?

message.author: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d
message.text: is pretty frustrated with our system overall
